title: LogIn
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is already logged into the Operator Tool at https://sop-qa.mlb.com/
custom_steps:
AND the user enters the "username" into the username field
AND the user enters the "password" into the password field
WHEN the user clicks on the login button
custom_expected: THEN the user should be redirected to the Operator Tool dashboard

title: Log Out
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is already logged into the Operator Tool at https://sop-qa.mlb.com/
custom_steps: WHEN a user selects the "Logout" button
custom_expected: THEN the user is successfully logged out

title: start stream
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the homepage https://sop-qa.mlb.com/
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on the "Provision Tool" tile on the dashboard
AND the user clicks on the "Provision HOME" or "Provision AWAY" feed button
AND the user clicks on the "Start Stream" button
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see the status changed to "Provisioned"
THEN the user should see the status change to "RUNNING"

title: End stream
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the homepage https://sop-qa.mlb.com/
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on the "Provision Tool" tile
    AND the user selects the game that has already been provisioned
    AND the user clicks the "End Stream" button to end the stream
custom_expected: THEN the user should see the status change from running to "ENDED"

title: Archive stream
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is on the homepage https://sop-qa.mlb.com/
AND the stream is up and running
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on the "Provision Tool" tile
AND the user select the feed and clicks on the "End Stream" button
custom_expected:
THEN the user sees the "Archive Stream" button
AND the user is able to archive the stream

title: Provision a stream
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the homepage https://sop-qa.mlb.com/
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on the "Provision Tool" tile
AND the user clicks on the "Provision Home" or "Provision Away" feed button
custom_expected: THEN the user should see the status change to "Provisioned"

title: Cycle through the different days on the calendar
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the homepage https://sop-qa.mlb.com/
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates to the "Provision Tool" tile
AND the user clicks on the arrow (left or right) on the date box
AND the user selects a specific date from the calendar
custom_expected:
THEN the calendar should display the selected date's data
AND the URL should display the selected date

title: DEPROVISION a feed
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the homepage https://sop-qa.mlb.com/
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on the "Provision Tool" tile
AND the user clicks on the "Provision Home" or "Provision Away" feed button
AND the user sees the Deprovision button
AND the user clicks on the Deprovision button to Deprovision a feed
custom_expected: THEN the game has been Deprovisioned

title: Add experience override
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the homepage https://sop-qa.mlb.com/
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on the "Experience Override" tile 
AND the user clicks on "+ Add Experience Override"
AND the user sees the "Create Override" modal
And the user enters the "OktaId"
And the user selects the "Client Type"
And the user selects the "Experience"
And the user selects the "Features"
And the user clicks on the "Save" button
custom_expected: THEN the user sees a success message

title: Search by newly created override
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the homepage at https://sop-qa.mlb.com/
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on the "Experience Override" tile
AND the user clicks in the "Search..." box
AND the user enters the "Okta ID" in the "Search..." box
custom_expected: THEN the user should see the newly created override

title: Edit experience override
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the homepage https://sop-qa.mlb.com/
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on the "Experience Override" tile
AND the user clicks in the "Search..." box
AND the user enters the "Okta ID" in the "Search..." box
AND the user clicks on the "Edit Override" button
AND the user edits the information in the Update Override modal
AND the user clicks on the "Save" button
custom_expected: THEN the user should see the Updated Override toast message at the top of the page

title: Delete experience override
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the homepage https://sop-qa.mlb.com/
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on the "Experience Override" tile
AND the user clicks in the "Search..." box
AND the user enters the "Okta ID" in the "Search..." box
AND the user clicks on the "Delete Override" button
AND the Delete Override confirm popup, pops-up
AND the user clicks on the red "Delete" button
custom_expected: THEN the user should see the Override Deleted toast message at the top of the page

User Lookup
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the “Streaming Operator Platform"
GIVEN the user is either an Admin, Customer Support, and/ or Product Manager
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on the "IP Override" tile on the dashboard
WHEN the user types and enters an email in the "Enter an email to look up user information" box
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see the "Enter an email to look up user information" box
THEN the user should see the "User Info"
AND the user should see the "ID", "EMAIL", "First Name" and "Last Name" column
AND the user should see the "+ Create Override" button(s) are present inside the accordion bodies under "Conviva Sessions"

title: Overrides
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the “Streaming Operator Platform"
GIVEN the user is either an Admin, Customer Support, and/ or Product Manager
GIVEN the user has successfully looked up Okta information for a user by email
GIVEN the user has selected a Conviva session
custom_steps: WHEN the "+ Create Override" button is clicked
custom_expected: THEN the user should see the information from the Conviva Session pre-populated in the Overrides form

title: Blackout overrides for a specific user
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on the “Streaming Operator Platform"
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on the "IP Override" tile on the dashboard
WHEN the user types and enters an email in the "Enter an email to look up user information" box
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see the "Enter an email to look up user information" box
THEN the user should Okta information is returned
AND any current IP Overrides for that customer should be returned

List of card links for each tool should be rendered
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the “Streaming Operator Platform"
GIVEN the user is an Admin
custom_steps:
WHEN the user is on the homepage
WHEN the user clicks on the card
WHEN the user clicks on the BTC Tools
WHEN the user clicks on the Experience Override
WHEN the user clicks on the Blackout Override
WHEN the user clicks on the Logger
WHEN the user clicks on the Media Services
WHEN the user clicks on the Media Validation
WHEN the user clicks on the Milestones
WHEN the user clicks on the Audit & Logging
WHEN the user clicks on the Provision Tool
WHEN the user clicks on Partner Stream Delivery
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see a list of cards on the homepage
THEN the user should see the card link for each tool renders
THEN the user should see the "Schedule", "Source Destination Mappings", "Venue Configs"
THEN the user should see the Override table with "ID", "Okta ID", "Client Type", "Experience", "Features"
THEN the user should see the "Okta Information Lookup"
AND an "Email" lookup information box
THEN the user should see a calendar "Date"
AND a table with "Game PK", "Matchup", "Venue", "Status", "Game Time", "Pipelines"
THEN the user should see two toggle switches "AWS", "GCP"
AND "Off", "On" toggle buttons
THEN the user should see "Litmus Validation Page"
THEN the user should see a calendar "Date" box
THEN the user should see "Schedule", "Search by Game", "Search by Media", "Search by User" tabs on top
THEN the user should see a table with "Game PK", "Matchup", "Venue", "Game Date", "Status"
THEN the user should see "Channels, "Targets"

![](index.php?/attachments/get/14247019)

title: List of card links for each tool should be rendered
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is an Admin
AND the user is on the “Streaming Operator Platform"
custom_steps:
WHEN the user lands on the Home page
AND the user clicks on the BTC Tools
AND the user clicks on the Experience Override
AND the user clicks on the Blackout Override
AND the user clicks on the Logger
AND the user clicks on the Media Services
AND the user clicks on the Media Validation
AND the user clicks on the Milestones

AND the user clicks on the Provision Tool
AND the user clicks on Partner Stream Delivery

AND the user should see the "Schedule", "Source Destination Mappings", "Venue Configs" on the "BTC Tools" page
AND the user should see the Override table with "ID", "Okta ID", "Client Type", "Experience", "Features" on the "Experience Override" page
AND the user should see the "Okta Information Lookup"
AND the user should see the "User Lookup" tab
AND the user should see the "Overrides" on the "Blackout Override" page
AND the user should see a "Date" picker
AND a "Search..." box
AND a table with "Game PK", "Matchup", "Venue", "Status", "Game Time", "Pipelines" on the "Logger" page
AND the user should see the "Content Sources" tab
AND two toggle switches "AWS" and "GCP" 
AND "Off", "On" toggle switches on the "Media Services" page
AND the user should see the "Litmus" tab on the "Litmus Validation Page"
AND the user should see the calendar "Date" picker
AND the user should see today's scheduled games along with "Edit Milestones" button on the "Milestones" page
AND the user should see "Schedule", "Search by Game", "Search by Media", "Search by User" tabs on the "Audit & Logging" page
AND the user should see a table with "Game PK", "Matchup", "Venue", "Game Date", "Status" on the "Provision Tool" page
AND the user should see "Channels, "Targets" on the "Partner Stream Delivery" page

title: Litmus Tool Search
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the “Streaming Operator Platform"
AND the user has Admin access
AND the user is already logged in
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on the “Media Validation” tile on the dashboard
AND the user inputs a valid query into the “Search for GamePK” box. For example: 747090
AND the user inputs an invalid GamePK into the “Search for GamePK” box
AND the user inputs special characters into the “Search for GamePK” box
AND the user inputs an exact GamePK into the “Search for GamePK” box
AND the user types into the “Search for GamePK” box
AND the user inputs multiple keywords into the “Search for GamePK” box
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see the “Search For GamePK” box displayed above the games component
AND the user should see only the matching GamePK results for the games of that day
AND the user should see “No Games Today” on the page
AND the user should see “No Games Today” on the page
AND the user should see the “Validation Suite” for the exact GamePK that was entered into the “Search for GamePK” box
AND the user should not see any autocomplete suggestions while typing
AND the user should see “No Games Today” on the page

![](index.php?/attachments/get/14343120)

![](index.php?/attachments/get/14343119)

custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the “Streaming Operator Platform"
AND the user has Admin access
AND the user is already logged in
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on the BTC Tools tile on the dashboard
AND the user clicks on the previous button on the calendar 
AND the user clicks on the next button on the calendar

title: BTC Tools | EVI Status Switch Toggle Disabled

AND the user clicks on the EVI toggle switch from "Enabled" to "Disabled"
custom_expected:

AND the user should see the toggle become disabled while the mutation is in progress
AND the toggle should re-enable once the mutation is complete
AND the EVI switch should now show as “Disabled”

title: Pipeline Configs
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the “Streaming Operator Platform"
AND the user has Admin access
AND the user is already logged in
custom_steps:

AND the user clicks on the first dropdown in the accordion list
AND the user clicks on the Edit button

AND the user clicks on the Save button
AND the user clicks on the Confirm button
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see the "Schedule" page by default
AND the user should see the "Source Destination Mappings" page
AND the user should see a list of all the teams in an accordion format
AND the user should see a list of pipeline config consist of "Team ID", "Config ID"
AND the user should see the following:
|||:Left Section :|:Right Section:
|| Backhaul Decoder Host |EVI Program Switch Source 
|| Fronthaul Decoder Host |EVI Switch Destination
|| Cam 4 Decoder Host|Program Swtich Destination 
|| Backhaul Decoder Service Label |  PD 01 Destination
|| Fronthaul Decoder Service Label |  PD 02 Destination
|| Cam 4 Decocder Service Label |  PD 03 Destination
|| Primary Backhaul Source| Active Source  
|| Primary Fronthaul Source | Alta Channel URL
|| Program Switch Source |Lexi Instance URL
|| Pre-game Source |  SDP URL Video
|| Post-game Source |  SDP URL Audio
|| EVI Backhaul Source |  SDP URL Ancillary
|| Cam 4 Source |  EVI SDP URL Video
|| | EVI SDP URL Audio

AND the user should be able to Edit the Pipelines Config
AND the user should be able to edit the "EVI Program Switch Source"
AND the user should see a "Confirm Pipeline Config Update" pop up
AND the user should see a confirmation banner at the top of the page saying "Pipeline config successfully updated"

title: BTC Tools | Multicasting Mapping
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the [SOP Tool](https://sop-npd.mlb.com/)
AND the user is logged in
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on the "BTC Tools" tile
AND the user clicks on the "Multicast Mapping" Tab on the top right side of BTC Tools page
AND the user clicks on the "Add Multicast Mapping" button
AND the user enters the call sign into the "Call Sign" input field. ( For example: "ABC", "ARID")
AND the user clicks on "Priority" from the dropdown. ( For example: "PRIMARY", "BACKUP", "DTV")
AND the user enters the multicast address in the input field, using a format like (udp://239.130.25.1:8000)
AND the user selects the "Source Location" from the dropdown. (For example: "SCS1" or "DNV1")
AND the user clicks on the Submit button
custom_expected:
THEN the user should land on the "Schedule" Page
AND the user should land the "Multicast Mapping" page
AND the user should see a "Add Multicast Mapping" popup form
AND the user should see the call sign entered text displayed in the Call Sign field
AND the user should see a menu appears with the available options: "PRIMARY", "BACKUP" and "DTV" allowing the user to select one
AND the user should see the selected Priority displayed on the screen
AND the user should see the entered multicast address on the screen
AND the user should see the selected source location in the field after selection
AND the user should see the newly created mapping has been added to the Multicast Mapping table

![](index.php?/attachments/get/14534991)

![](index.php?/attachments/get/14534992)

![](index.php?/attachments/get/14534993)

custom_expected:
THEN the user should see the "Mapping" Tab
AND the user should see the scroll indicator in "Channels" and "Targets" view
AND the user should see the position in the scrollable list adjust to reflect the position of the scroll indicator
![](index.php?/attachments/get/14238917)

title: ESNI Management Media ID view
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is already logged into the "Stream Operator Platform"
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on the "ESNI Management" tile
AND the user clicks on the "Details" button
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see the list of all available MediaIDs on the "Media ID" page
AND the user should see each row contain "Media Type", "Sub Type", "Call Sign" and a "Details" button
AND the user should see a "Search" box filter on top right corner of the screen
AND the user should see a details shelf opens from the right side of the screen

title: ESNI Management Policies view
ESNI Management Audiences view
Hamburger Menu - User Navigation and Page Responsiveness
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on the “Streaming Operator Platform"
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on the left carrot icon in the navigation panel
WHEN the user clicks on the hamburger menu icon
AND the user should see the MLB Logo
custom_expected:

title: LogIn
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on the “Streaming Operator Platform"
custom_steps:
WHEN the user enters the "username" into the username field
AND the user enters the "password" into the password field
AND the user clicks on the login button
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see the username entered into the username field
THEN the user should see the password entered into the password field
THEN the user should see the page being redirected to the Operator Tool dashboard

title: Log Out
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on the “Streaming Operator Platform"
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on their initials on the top right corner of the page
AND the user clicks on the "Logout" button
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see their full name and the logout button 
THEN the user should see this message "Welcome to the Streaming Operator Platform"

title: Enable Copy Okta ID & Token Access for logged in users
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the “Streaming Operator Platform"
AND all users regardless of group or access level are logged in
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on the Settings gear
AND the user clicks on the "ID" button in the Okta Info section
AND the user clicks on the "Access Token" button in the Okta Info section
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see a pop up modal with "Okta Info" section
AND the "ID" automatically gets copied to the clipboard
AND the "Access Token" automatically gets copied to the clipboard

![](index.php?/attachments/get/14329732)

title: Disable Copy Okta ID & Token Access for logged out users
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the “Streaming Operator Platform"
AND the user is logged out
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks on "Settings" located at the bottom left side of the page
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see the "Version" and the version number. For example: v5.2.0
AND the user should see "Theme" icon to change the theme 
![](index.php?/attachments/get/14329733)
